title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationEventSourcing - Q0001
text: What is the main idea behind the Event Sourcing pattern?

options.text: Persisting the state of an entity as a sequence of events
Storing only the latest state of an entity
Using a shared database for all services

explanation: Event Sourcing stores all changes to an entity as a sequence of events rather than just the current state.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationEventSourcing - Q0002
text: What does each event in Event Sourcing represent?

options.text: A state change that has occurred in the system
A command to perform an action
A snapshot of the entire database

explanation: Each event represents a state change that has already occurred in the system.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationEventSourcing - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of Event Sourcing?

options.text: Provides a complete audit trail of all changes
Eliminates the need for event logs

explanation: Event Sourcing provides a full audit trail by storing every change as an event.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationEventSourcing - Q0004
text: How is the current state of an entity reconstructed in Event Sourcing?

options.text: By replaying all events for that entity
By reading the latest snapshot only

explanation: The current state is reconstructed by replaying all events associated with the entity.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationEventSourcing - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in Event Sourcing?
explanation: Managing event versioning and schema evolution is a common challenge in Event Sourcing.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationEventSourcing - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a benefit of Event Sourcing for reliability?

options.text: Allows rebuilding state after system failures

explanation: Event Sourcing allows rebuilding state by replaying events after a failure.

explanation: Events are typically stored in an event store or append-only log for durability and replay.
